action.action-desc: Mr. Michael F. Doyle of Pennsylvania (for himself and Mr. Smith of New Jersey) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Animal Welfare Act to ensure that all dogs and cats used by research facilities are obtained legally.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Pet Safety and Protection Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Section 7 of the Animal Welfare Act (7 U.S.C. 2137) is amended to read as follows:

section.header: Sources of dogs and cats for research facilities

subsection.text: In this section, the term person means any individual, partnership, firm, joint stock company, corporation, association, trust, estate, pound, shelter, or other legal entity.

No research facility or Federal research facility may use a dog or cat for research or educational purposes if the dog or cat was obtained from a person other than a person described in subsection (d).

subsection.header: Selling, donating, or offering dogs and cats
subsection.text: No person, other than a person described in subsection (d), may sell, donate, or offer a dog or cat to any research facility or Federal research facility.

A person from whom a research facility or a Federal research facility may obtain a dog or cat for research or educational purposes under subsection (b), and a person who may sell, donate, or offer a dog or cat to a research facility or a Federal research facility under subsection (c), shall be—

paragraph.text: a dealer licensed under section 3 that has bred and raised the dog or cat;
a publicly owned and operated pound or shelter that—

subparagraph.text: is in compliance with section 28(a)(1) and with the requirements for dealers in subsections (b) and (c) of section 28; and
obtained the dog or cat from its legal owner, other than a pound or shelter;

paragraph.text: a person that is donating the dog or cat and that—

subparagraph.text: bred and raised the dog or cat; or
owned the dog or cat for not less than 1 year immediately preceding the donation;

paragraph.text: a research facility licensed by the Secretary; and
a Federal research facility licensed by the Secretary.
A person that violates this section shall be fined $1,000 for each violation.
A penalty under this subsection shall be in addition to any other applicable penalty.

subsection.text: Nothing in this section requires a pound or shelter to sell, donate, or offer a dog or cat to a research facility or Federal research facility.
Section 8 of the Animal Welfare Act (7 U.S.C. 2138) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Sec. 8. No department and inserting the following:

section.text: Except as provided in section 7, no department

paragraph.text: by striking research or experimentation or; and
by striking such purposes and inserting that purpose.

subsection.text: Section 28(b)(1) of the Animal Welfare Act (7 U.S.C. 2158(b)(1)) is amended by striking individual or entity and inserting research facility or Federal research facility.

section.text: The amendments made by section 2 take effect on the date that is 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
